38897257.review:
TLDR: After the nice and relaxing Zenge, Michal Pawlowski rises to excellence with Art of Gravity.

As the game summary says, Art of Gravity is a voxel / physics puzzle game - and good physics puzzles are surprisingly hard to come by. Either the physics are clunky, or the level design is weak, or, most frequently, both. Michal elegantly solved both problems in one go - he built a sandbox game where the physics are taken very seriously, and chose a visual implementation that makes watching the mechanics in action a real pleasure. 
Your task is to launch balls at cubes. Balls cause cubes to disintegrate into small cubes, which fly all over the place, damaging or destroying other cubes as they go. This is already fun - the kinetic energy of the action is really visceral. Then, the demolition becomes more and more difficult as new blocks with different properties are introduced (read: they become tougher and tougher), and you'll have more elaborate balls to wreak your havok as well.
With all the enjoyment of wanton destruction going on, I have to touch on one the game's only weakness - it's rather easy. Experimenting with new materials is superb, but then the solution just presents itself. 60-65 of the 75 levels flow by pretty self-evidently - only the last 10-15 were decent headscratchers.

Ah, I wanted to write a short review, but obviously couldn't :) I loved Art of Gravity, and while these games are short, they're excellent value for money at the low asking price. If you like puzzle games, make sure to give it a shot!

A simple yet fascinating puzzle game. As you can see in the trailer, the animations when you destroy blocks are mesmerizing. The game is fun in itself and is fun to solve, but truly the animations are what makes the challenges so satisfying to overcome, and what will hook you and get you to finish it. Also, the rules are not explicitly taught, which in my opinion makes a puzzle game more enjoyable and shows it is well designed.

The one criticism I have is that sometimes, the physics are a bit unpredictable, and therefore it makes some puzzles harder to solve for the wrong reasons. However, I still managed to beat the game in around 2 hours, so it's not really that big of a deal: just be aware that some puzzles will feel a bit random. If you enjoy the genre and you can handle the occasional less polished puzzle, then please go ahead and play it!

37967225.review:
Despite being a little janky and very simple graphically, Art of Gravity does a nice job of wordlessly teaching and engaging you in 3D demolition puzzles that have little to do with gravity.

In spite of the fact that I felt bias towards the very ‘Unity’ graphics, I found completing the few more taxing puzzles, or just making stuff explode, quiet satisfying. That being said, there are only maybe 5-10 puzzles that will take you more than a couple minutes to plan out. I had high hopes for a few of the achievements that sounded like they’d bring a second life into a few puzzles. However, the puzzles that do leave you with the option to use less orbs on them are usually really forgiving. You’ll bumped into each one without breaking a sweat. 

Also, that damn jingle sound effect is back from Zenge and it still clips itself and is as cheesy as ever. Thankfully, you can disable the sfx and bgm if you’d rather listen to music or a podcast.

Can barely recommend it on its own, although it’s a killer deal as a part of the steam ‘Relaxing Puzzle Box’ Bundle which also includes several other games by Michal Pawlowski.

The game does hold a lot of potential however. A few more types of orbs or bricks or portals could create some more engaging puzzles. Sadly, like all the other Puzzle Box games, it ends rather quickly, has no steam workshop and is more of a tech demo/mini project that displays an interesting puzzle idea that the devs had.

Still, Art of Gravity is a good way to loosen up while mulling over some straightforward puzzles.

In short, this game was a wonderful experience. It is definitely a game for someone who likes a bit of a challenge, and what better way to excercise one´s mind than by playing a puzzle game. I will just cut to the chase and mention  its pros and cons as briefly as I can. 

Pros:
 -Beautiful, yet simple design 
-It challenges your mind 
-It's cheap
-It actually delivers a sense of accomplishment 
- Enjoyable destruction
-Its difficulty is on point 
-Very addictive indeed 
-It is a good way to distract and de-stress one´s mind
-Very well programmed (No glitches or anything of that sort)  
-Immersive music 
-Sharp graphics 
-A very good level design, and some interesting interactive levels 

Cons:
- More achievements? Although I know its hard, given the nature of the game.
-I will definitely have to concur with some of the other reviewers. More levels! The experience was awesome and left me wanting for more. 

Overall: 9/10 Because I thought it needs more levels. It would be great if they actually added more to it. 


If you like the puzzle genre this game is a must, and if you don´t like it then you sure as hell should give it a try!

35244040.review:
Des objets en 3D qui flottent dans l'espace dans une ambiance visuelle et sonore adéquatement minimaliste.
On choisit la bonne trajectoire pour propulser un certain nombre de boules à disposition pour tout détruire.

J'aime les gratte-ciels qui s'effondrent dans des gerbes de béton, j'aime les feux d'artifice qui font briller les yeux des enfants, j'aime les explosions pas uniquement de joie, j'aime voir des murs qui se disloquent en petits morceaux et s'éparpillent façon puzzle, j'aime l'odeur du napalm le matin, j'adore pouvoir arborer avec fierté mon petit sourire sadique quand j'ai trouvé le moyen de tout bousiller et de ne laisser derrière moi qu'un petit tas de confettis. A défaut d'avoir un arsenal sous la main, y a Art of Gravity et si toi aussi tu veux tout faire péter, ce jeu est là pour toi.

Les premiers niveaux nous permettent d'intégrer en douceur le principe puis de nouveaux mécanismes de gameplay sont progressivement introduits. Obstacles, possibilités de manipuler et déplacer certains éléments, projectiles avec des propriétés particulières, blocs plus solides, bombes, etc...

Les niveaux sont variés mais il ne faut jamais plus de quelques secondes pour que la solution soit évidente. On peut débloquer des succès sur certains niveaux si on le réussit sans avoir recours à tous les projectiles. Les plus perspicaces auront terminé tous les niveaux en 2h environ.


Je recommande et à ce prix, chacun peut y aller les yeux fermés.

34863744.review:
A fun little puzzler that feels way to short! The concept is simple and beautifully executed. You launch different balls at a variety of different boxes, bombs, and launchers and try to remove all pieces from play. There's a limited amount of balls at your disposal, but each level is easy to complete, including earning all achievements (they all require you to complete a particular level with at least one ball left in store). At first, there is a little bit of a learning curve as you learn what each type of ball does and how it interacts with the other puzzle components, but its not terribly difficult and if you mess around a bit, you'll quickly learn. There's an undo button in the event you launch in the wrong direction and each puzzle presents a unique challenge. Overall, I found it quite enjoyable though I wish it was longer and had more puzzles.


Pros:
+Pleasant Atmosphere
+Ambient Music
+Attractive Graphics + Satisfying Demolition
+Easy Achievements
+Quick
+Immersive

Cons:
-Short (Only 75 puzzles; Wish there was more, a sequel, or expansion)


Mehs:
-No tutorial (though a little messing around and you'll figure everything out.

Overall, I'd give it a 9.8 out of 10 and fingers crossed for a sequel!

34151100.review:
Après le très bon [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/461840][i][b]Zenge[/b][/i][/url], le gars qui se cache derrière [i]Hamster on Coke[/i] nous livre ici [i][b]Art of Gravity[/b][/i], un puzzle-game à la réalisation impeccable et fun au point que vous risquez fort d'en redemander, sitôt le jeu terminé.

Ici, l'objectif est de détruire une figure en trois dimensions, constituée de cubes de couleurs diverses et de boules, qui sont au nombre de trois : la bombe, grise, dont l'effet ne vous aura pas échappé ; la verte, qui renvoie dans la direction opposée un projectile de même nature que celui qui l'aura percutée ; enfin, la jaune, qui répercute le coup reçu, éventuellement dans plusieurs directions (comme au billard), en conservant là aussi les propriétés de ce qui l'aura frappée. A cela s'ajoutent deux mécanismes : le premier vous permettra de déplacer certains éléments du décor selon des axes prédéfinis ; le second de les faire pivoter. Vous suivez jusque-là ? Parce que ce n'est pas terminé !

En effet, pour détruire cette figure, vous disposerez d'un certain nombre de projectiles - des boules - eux aussi de couleurs variables : blancs, rouges ou bleus. Quel intérêt, me direz-vous ? C'est très simple. Disons que les blancs sont les projectiles de base. Les rouges, plus robustes, bénéficient d'une capacité de destruction accrue. Quant à eux, les bleus ont deux effets notables : d'une part, ils peuvent briser des sortes d'écrans obstruant le passage ; d'autre part, ils sont encore plus efficaces que les rouges, à ceci près qu'ils détruisent les blocs sans laisser de fragment. Comprenez par là, pas de dégâts collatéraux ; lesquels sont par ailleurs très bien gérés, grâce à une physique irréprochable.

Sachez en outre que vous pourrez choisir l'orientation du lancer, du moins dans une certaine mesure, et que celui-ci aura, il va sans dire, une importance cruciale. Autre détail significatif, la couleur des cubes qui composent le décor leur confère des propriétés de solidité similaires à celles des projectiles. Ce qui donne, par ordre croissant de robustesse : blanc ; rouge ; vert - ce dernier m'a semblé plus sensible aux explosions, mais je ne saurais l'affirmer avec certitude. Et enfin, comme si cela ne suffisait pas, vous aurez parfois l'occasion de glâner des projectiles supplémentaires en détruisant une certaine quantité de cubes d'une certaine couleur.

Autant dire qu'en dépit d'une relative brièveté, compensée toutefois par un prix dérisoire, [i][b]Art of Gravity[/b][/i] propose un gameplay et des mécaniques très riches, exploitées avec beaucoup d'intelligence à travers soixante-quinze niveaux. Je ne saurais donc trop vous encourager à l'acheter, car il y a bien peu de chances pour que vous vous sentiez floué !

[h1]Verdict : 4,5/5 - Excellent, à acheter les yeux fermés ![/h1]

34103145.review:
Art of Gravity is a minimalistic 3D physics puzzle game. In each of the 75 levels your goal is to clear out all the cubes by shooting balls into the play area. The cubes are actually built of voxels and will shatter into smaller pieces when hit. These voxels will fall down and can break other cubes leading into impressive chain reactions.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The minimalistic visuals work quite well for a game like this. Shattering a large number of cubes into voxels at once actually looks quite impressive.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
The sound effects and music are both pretty basic, but they get the job done. There is no voice acting.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The gameplay is pretty simple. You have few different types of cubes and balls, which interact with each other in slightly different ways. Many of the levels also include additional elements such as glass walls or objects you can move along a track. Many of the more complex levels require you to set up impressive chain reactions that take care of lots of cubes with a single ball.

The puzzles themselves are generally well-designed and fun to solve. The core mechanics are quite simple but the game does a good job of introducing new gameplay elements to keep things interesting. Some of the levels also have achievements for solving them without using all the balls, but these bonus goals are purely optional.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]
Personally I felt that the game was too easy. Most of the early puzzles are quite simple and even towards the end there are only a few puzzles that provide any real challenge. I would have loved to see some trickier puzzles myself.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
The controls work quite well with a mouse and keyboard. A few times I did have some trouble lining up the exact shot I wanted, but this is not a big problem as none of the puzzles require precise timing.

[h1]Story and Writing[/h1]
The game does not really have a story or any writing for that matter.

[h1]Bugs and Glitches[/h1]
I didn't encounter any major bugs or issues.

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
Art of Gravity is a fun and creative puzzle game. It is quite short and most of the puzzles are rather easy. Still, at this price point it's easy to recommend the game to any puzzle game fans.

It took me little under 1.5 hours to solve all the puzzles.

33950843.review:
A fun little physics game. You start out with a floating bundle of cubes, and then proceed to throw balls at them until they break. I think it might be some sort of metaphor for my high school years.
 When hit most cubes will shatter in a shower of voxels, which will in turn cascade down and possibly cause more damage. Your goal is to get rid of all the floating elements with a limited number of balls.
 As the game goes on you get cubes and balls of different colors, which behave in different ways, and on some levels you get the ability to arrange the board to facilitate your virtual vandalism.
 And it’s really satisfying! The sight of cube fragments interacting against each other and other elements never really gets old, and that’s as fine as any reward a computer game could give. Most of the puzzles are very simple, though some on the last stretch require a bit of thinking (or a lot of trial and error).
 You can only throw at fixed angles, so it’s not too fiddly - though being physics-based, a little unpredictability is unavoidable. If it sounds at all like your sort of thing, it’s an easy recommendation at slightly less than a quid (or whatever heathen money is used outside of the empire).

物理挙動パズルゲーム。
ボールをぶつけて全てのブロックを破壊するパズルだ。全75レベル。
全てのステージには各種ボールの使用回数が設定されているので、その使用回数の範囲内で全てのブロックを破壊できるように考える必要がある。しかし、全体的な難易度は低くレベル60を越えるあたりから少し難しくなってくる程度なので、テンポ良くプレイしていける。爆弾を爆発させて破壊する若干の爽快感がある。
また、物理演算を使用しているといっても予想範囲外のことが起きることは少なく挙動は安定している。せいぜいボールを発射してから少し待っていれば、上にいったボールが落ちてきてそれで他のブロックを破壊して手数を稼ぐことができる場面があるくらいだ。ほとんどの場合は、上にあるブロックを破壊するとその欠片が下にあるブロックを破壊する程度に留まっている。
価格も安く手軽にプレイするには良いパズルだと思う。

33430610.review:
[b]Art of Gravity jest świetną grą logiczną, przy której trzeba trochę pomyśleć.[/b]

[h1]OPRAWA[/h1]
Wpadamy w świat zagadek, gdzie każdy rodzaj przedmiotów ma inny kolor, przy połączeniu kilku elementów robi się naprawdę ładnie. Według mnie największą zaletą tej produkcji jest świetna fizyka, która jest naszym sprzymierzeńcem. Bardzo dobrym posunięciem było dodanie jednolitego koloru tła, co sprawiło, że nic nas nie rozprasza i całą uwagę możemy skupić na rozwiązaniu zagadki. Ogólnie mówiąc oprawa graficzna jest idealna w swojej prostocie. Udźwiękowienie jest przyjemne dla ucha, co sprawia, że nie denerwujemy się nawet wtedy, gdy nam coś nie wychodzi.

[h1]ROZGRYWKA[/h1]
Art Of gravity na początku sprawia wrażenie dosyć łatwej gry, gdzie musimy po prostu zniszczyć wszystko co widzimy na ekranie, uważając jednocześnie, aby nie skończyły nam się dostępne "kule zniszczenia". Po kilku poziomach otrzymujemy dostęp do coraz to nowszych przedmiotów, które musimy ze sobą łączyć, żeby przejść dalej. Bardzo podoba mi się poziom trudności, ponieważ zwiększany jest on poprzez dodawanie kolejnych rzeczy, wymagających powiązania, przez co twórca wyeliminował dziesiątki elementów, z którymi trzeba coś zrobić, sprawiając, naszym zadaniem jest spostrzeganie i przewidywanie co się stanie, jeśli zrobię tak, a nie inaczej, dodatkowo możemy cofać każdy ruch, dzięki czemu nie musimy zaczynać poziomu od nowa gdy coś zepsujemy.

[h1]PODSUMOWUJĄC[/h1]
Otrzymujemy logiczną grę, z wyważonym poziomem trudności, który jest podwyższany poprzez dodawanie kolejnych możliwości zniszczenia. Szeroko rozumiana oprawa jest bardzo ładna oraz przyjemna dla oka i ucha. Według mnie, jest to produkcja idealna na wieczorne odstresowanie.

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓRZY NIE LUBIĄ CZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Ładna grafika
+ Świetna fizyka
+ Sposób podnoszenia poziomu trudności
+ Bardzo niska cena
+ Trzeba przy niej trochę pomyśleć
+ Miły dla ucha soundtrack
+ Możliwość cofania ruchów
+ Sporo elementów
+ Osiągnięcia steam

- Brak możliwości ustawienia kamery w dowolnym punkcie

33300345.review:
(This review was supplied by Daniël - REX 💖Gaming of REX Network!  Many thanks!)

[h1]A pleasant puzzle game about destroying blocks with balls.[/h1]

Not often is it that a new innovative game using a simple concept lands on my lap.  Much to the nature that was [i]Portal[/i], you'll be introduced to new concepts through simple puzzles before being thrust into some of the more advanced puzzles.  That said, I originally thought that [i]Art of Gravity[/i] was going to be a pretentious art game.  However, I was pleasantly surprised when I saw what [i]Art of Gravity[/i] had to offer.

In your arsenal are white balls (the weakest), red balls (which are more durable and stronger), and blue balls (which phase through all blocks in its bath and can destroy glass).  Against you are white blocks (weak), red blocks (strong), path balls (which spit out balls in directional paths after being struck), and teleportation balls (which are green), which must ALL be destroyed..and are occassionally surrounded by glass.

There are 75 levels and most of the puzzles.  Again, they are mostly simple, though there are a few that will have you scratching your head as you ponder about the solution.  You'll be able to figure out the solution, though...if you give each puzzle enough time.  A single playthrough ended up taking me 2 hours, though each playthrough now may take much less time.

If I have any complaints about [i]Art of Gravity[/i], it's that the replayability is low.  For only $1, you'll find approximately 2 hours worth of gameplay...about the length of Portal.  It's nice to see cubes explode, but like with most puzzle games, you'll figure out the solutions and have less reason to come back to it...unless you want to relive a relaxing puzzle game, that is.

Do I recommend [i]Art of Gravity[/i]?  To be honest, I'd say that for asking price, it's worth it.  Though if you want to wait for a sale when this game is discounted, I wouldn't blame you for it, especially since it's essentially 50 cents per hour.  If you're looking for a casual puzzle game with a new, but simple concept involving balls, trajectory, and gravity, I'd say to consider giving this game a try.

9/10  Circular pegs don't fit into square holes....but in this case, they do!

33286223.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Puzzle games on Steam whether they’re in 2D or full 3D, shall always represent the much needed break from narrative-based titles. Those games that like to focus on more things at once, tend to stress gamers to a certain degree. And if you test them out + write about them on a regular basis like I do, well, you definitely need gaming’s equivalent of a pause. Without racing towards the other extreme: casual, mobile “games”. Irony has it, that Art of Gravity is also on mobile platforms, yet it cannot share the shame of any pathetic cash grabs as it sadly has to share space with them on smartphones or tablets. Unless you buy the PC version, of course.

Lucky for us Steam gamers, we have literally hundreds of options to choose from. The one I’m reviewing today, is among the better ones on the Store and its small price tag, really doesn’t do this game justice. On both PC and iOS, Art of Gravity’s asking price is still one single buck. Its developer/publisher is by no means, a newcomer. Hamster On Coke Games (creative title, I know) have already graced gamers with other affordable brain teasers such as, Hook, Zenge or klocki.

[h1]Story[/h1]
The story in Art Of Gravity features the complex system adopted primarily by puzzle games. No story here, buddy! What, you really expected a plotline to these abstract & physics-based gameplay mechanics? It plays perfectly well without needing so much as a flimsy explanation or context. Not even a tutorial and this slightly annoyed me. Nonetheless, I don’t blame the devs for wanting players to dive right into the action though. Art Of Gravity has so many levels of various length in terms of completion time, that you won’t feel left out or bored. As with any similar titles from this genre, playing in short gaming sessions is the rule of thumb.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
If you played enough Steam indie titles so far, you’ll recognise Art of Gravity as being Unity-powered, right from its launch menu. What’s a certainty to me in such fortunate cases, is the stability which Unity Engine provides to all titles which feature its assets. While it isn’t by any means a pretentious game, Art of Gravity does looks great and I really enjoyed its minimal looks mixed with the voxel-style. You won’t have any trouble running this title, even on an older PC or low-end laptop.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
The soundtrack is severely limited but the sound effects are balancing that issue out, at least partially. I’d still recommend you listen to any tracks you might prefer and simply mute the repetitive tunes from in-game. Your choice, as always.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Art Of Gravity might lack a story or sound diversity, yet its gameplay is the perfect combination of eye candy and seemingly-simple puzzle design. I assure you that this is not the case. Sporting 75 levels of increasing complexity, you’ll definitely learn to play efficiently as you spend more time with it. The dev team prides itself on the fact that players are left to discover the gameplay mechanics by themselves. I guess, it’s part of the charm. Even the title screen appears after you’ve complete the first level quite out of the blue. Or purple to be more exact.

Colors play an important role and are used to distinguish between the several types of “materials” you’ll need to break apart with the balls you control. The spheres in question can be set on predetermined trajectories (collision courses, more likely) and Art of Gravity’s ultimate goal is to smash through the colored blocks, until they crumble to small pieces which fall from suspension. I might have phrased this more complicated than it truly is. In any case, it won’t be straightforward since various “walls” or block types can take multiple ball collisions until they are finally crumbling.

The bonus objective on some levels (and prerequisite for unlocking some of the game’s Achievements) is to crush all the blocks with as few balls as possible. You’ll be saving only one, in most cases. And even then it shall take some creative thinking, not to mention patience. You probably knew already, that puzzle games shouldn’t be treated with haste. Half of the fun is just the part where you figure them out. The rest is reserved, just for watching it play out. Seeing those small, colored pixels crumble and fall from considerable height, it reminded me of the late Lionhead Studios’ Black & White 2 logo.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2OPnZEXoVGs

Sad pandas right now, eh? Much like the (proper) god game genre itself, interactive logos are also a thing of the past.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Art Of Gravity wasn’t discounted so far, mainly because it is more than decently priced. If you’re still uncertain, wait  for a bundle offer perhaps. I have no idea if the game’s lacking Trading Cards because the developer didn’t implement them, or if Valve is enforcing their new policy on these Cards and no new games receive them until they sold a certain number of copies. I do hope they shall surface for this title eventually. For now, collectors shall have to contend with Steam Achievements. 

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Relaxing gameplay.
+ Pleasant visual style.
+ Steam Achievements.
+ Plenty of levels to choose from.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Lacking even a barebones tutorial.
- No Steam Trading Cards.
- Limited sound selection.

[b]Rating 75/100 [/b]

32800471.review:
全レベル（７５）をクリアーしたのでレビュー。

９／１０

値段を考えた場合に、お勧めしない理由が無い。

良い
・リラックスできるビジュアルと音楽
・適度な難易度
・程よく追加されるギミック

悪い
・時々起こるレンダリングバグ


「ゲーム内容」
四角いブロックに丸い球をぶつけて破壊することを目的とする。レベル内のすべてのブロックを規定の球数以内で崩すとクリアーとなる。マウスのみで操作でき、操作方法もクリック＆ドラッグだけの親切設計。全７５レベル（１レベルが１面）でパズルが特に苦手というのでなければ２時間くらいのボリューム。

ブロックは３Dなので６つの面から構成されている。また、物理演算がなされており、ぶつけた方向でブロックの崩壊の仕方が変わる。球数に制限があるので、どの面に球を衝突させるのかを考えながらプレイすることが基本となる。後はこれに頑丈なブロックや、貫通する球、爆発するブロック等のギミックが少しずつ加わっていくことになる。

失敗したときのリトライが容易で、画面左側に出るバックステップボタン（筆者が個人的にそう呼んでいる）を押せば使った球の回数で巻き戻せる。例を出すと「５回球をブロック群にぶつけた結果、全部を壊せなかった。だが３回目までは正解だと確信している。」その場合には２回バックステップボタンを押せばよい。

カジュアルな難易度でさくさく進んでいく。終盤はそれなりに頭をひねるパズルとなるが、高難易度というわけではない。


「バグ」
時々、リトライするときにバックステップボタンを押してもブロックが正しい位置に戻らないことがある。各レベルでオートセーブされているので、その場合には一度タイトル画面に戻ってやり直すとよい。やり直しはそのレベルの頭からだが、パズル自体の手数は殆どの場合で１０回以下なのでそれほどイラつくことも無い。

また、本当にたまに物理演算がうまく働かずにクリアーできる手順でクリアーできないことがある。筆者が通しでプレイした場合に２度ほど遭遇した。（プレイ中に「これでクリアー」と思った手順でクリアできず、「変だな？」と思いながらも同じ手順を試したらクリアーできたことで気がついた。）



「その他」
９９円という価格だが、ビジュアルもミニマルで綺麗に見せようと勤めており、BGMも雰囲気に良くマッチしている。

何かの合間の気分転換にうってつけ、仕事や他のゲームの合間の気分転換にどうぞ。

日本語有りだが、実は言語不要のパズルなので、ゲームの説明やら何やらで文字が出てくることは無い。一切無いので、自分で動かして結果を見て判断するだけの全言語共通仕様となっている。一応最終面では感謝の言葉が英語で記されているが、プレイには何の問題も無い。


※追記　２０１７年６月２８日　実績について
各実績の指定レベルにおいて、規定の球数よりも少ない球数でレベルをクリアーすると解除できる。

32419912.review:
I am up to my ears in complexity when it comes to covering games, and it is nice to take a break from those games to a simple puzzle game. The game isn't super difficult, and I never found myself taking more than 5 tries on each level. The levels are designed to be easy to complete and make you feel smart after you beat them.

The graphics are also simple, not making use of flashy or particularly great art, but the ambient sounds and associated music are fairly chill and fun to listen to while you solve simple puzzles.



The physics in Art of Gravity isn't anything new, and we have no shortage of physics games, that being said, these physics are pleasant to watch. I'm not sure if it's the slow motion, or the pretty patterns the voxels create; but either way, it is incredibly fun to watch. This alone helps the game be fun, as it helps you gain a sense of completion after you beat each stage.



Overall, Art of Gravity is exactly what it says, it's all about gravity. It is an entertaining game that gives you a solid stream of content throughout its levels. The art is basic, but the music and sound effects are good, and the levels are all unique, and I can see myself coming back to this game. With this in mind, Art of Gravity earns itself a 7 out of 10 with a label of "Satisfying".

32408717.review:
Стильная трехмерная головоломка, в которой проходим уровни разрушая разнообразные постройки.
Постройки состоят из элементов. В основном это кубики, которые при разрушении распадаются на кубики поменьше. Кроме них попадаются зеленые камни-телепорты, стеклянные платформы, бомбы и т.д. Некоторые объекты можно передвигать.
Для разрушения дают определенное количество шаров. Швыряем шары и наблюдаем за тем, как все разлетается и рассыпается. Это как ломать замки из песка! Увлекательное зрелище!
Стильная головоломка с приятной графикой и музыкой. Геймплей успокаивающий и расслабляющий. Единственный минус – игра довольно короткая, но своих денег стоит.

32405537.review:
[h1]«Art Of Gravity»[/h1]
Головоломка с элементами физики.

Наша задача разрушить все объекты на экране. Причем в игре присутствует гравитация – разрушаемые объекты падают вниз и задевая своими обломками могут разрушать остальные элементы. Это свойство надо учитывать и использовать для прохождения игры.

Игра выполнена в необычном графическом стиле. Картины рассыпающихся на мелкие элементы фигур приносить эстетическое удовольствие. Это зрелище завораживает, успокаивает и погружает медитативное состояние. Этому способствует звуковое сопровождение. 

Стильное меню выглядит очень эффектно, но выбор уровня сделан не очень удачно. Привычнее видеть картинку с номерами уровней, а тут можно лишь перещелкивать вперед или назад, выбирая текущий уровень из тех, что уже пройдены. При этом уровни представлены не арабскими цифрами, а схематичной картинкой. Непривычно и неудобно!

Геймплей расслабляющий, неспешный. Задачи несложные. Тут нет ограничений по времени и количеству попыток. Каждый шаг можно переигрывать. 

Игра создана приносить эстетическое наслаждение ценителям, а не напрягать или бросать вызов. Это как «Японский сад камней»! Ценители и эстеты оценят по достоинству это творение.

32401949.review:
游戏是第九艺术~

重力、解谜、暴力美感、方块，将这些元素几乎完美的揉合在了一起，这就是《重力艺术》。

如果非要让我给这一款游戏下一个分数的话，我觉得这是一种侮辱。虽然我并觉得重力艺术在各个方面都已经达到完美，但是在同一大类型解谜类里，对比zup、oik，重力艺术不仅在游戏关卡设计还是音乐成就都十分的良心，就像很多人讲的z、o卖的是成就而不是作品。

重力艺术的关卡设计得十分的合理，为什么用合理来形容？因为他不是单纯地逐步增添新元素与难度，而是将新元素与难度结合之后，又保留部分需要自己发掘的操作，不是简单的将各个方块试了个遍，也不是简单的考考你对时机的把握，你需要对整个局面进行布局，也需要考虑如何更好的运用手中的球，关卡循循渐进，到了后面部分你会发现第一眼都是一脸懵逼。所以你无法很快的解决一个关卡，也无法像吃快餐似的错过一个好游戏。

解谜游戏最重要的部分便是关卡与解谜元素，这两点重力艺术都做得十分的特别，再加上暴力美感的融合，真是满足了很大一部分人的审美与欲望，所以你在体验解谜的乐趣同时还有充分的视觉享受。

当然，就建议来说，我个人觉得本作还可以在视觉上下更多的功夫，可以在背景、方块的细节上等等，更加的炫酷，但如果觉得一个解谜游戏无需太多的花哨元素也是可以赞同的，另外，我个人觉得关卡作为一个完整的游戏来说还是有些许少，虽然游戏时间可以达到1~2个小时的程度，但是还是不够爽呐~我还要玩~23333333

简单讲重力艺术在同类游戏中可以算是佳作，打折入手是肯定不亏的，祝游戏愉快~

一大早发现更新了8个成就~那就再玩一遍~

本来以为是有部分bug存在的，经过大佬指点发现11关的成就需要留一颗球~23333后面那些成就留不留球球我都忘了都~

关于67关的不同通关方法昨天发了两张截图，开发者说很震惊，2333，说明这个游戏还是有很多地方值得大家共同去研究的~

最后感谢奶牛关野蔷薇及开发者的支持，奶牛关：https://cowlevel.net/feed

32399874.review:
Highly Recommended, 9/10

Use the Balls to SMASH the Blocks!

This is probably the best looking puzzle game I have seen, the lighting and effects of the falling voxels when you smash the blocks are beautifully done.

I would like to see a menu for selecting the level rather than scrolling through to find the one you want and the lack of Steam Trading Cards is a shame as I am sure the backgrounds earned from badges could be well worth having.

It would be good to see more levels as I was just really enjoying the challenge. Having said that, the levels did get dificult enough to give a good sense of sattisfaction when completed and one or two managed to really get me thinking for a few minutes. To be fair the developer does give an honest time in his description but take your time and enjoy the graphics and the marvelous physics and it will give you at least a couple hours of real enjoyment. 

Overall a great little game, very sattisfying to play and well worth the price!!

39493370.review:
Kaputt machen! Yay!

Art of Gravity ist ein kleines Denkspiel mit 75 interessanten Leveln. In dem Spiel geht es darum, Blöcke kaputt zu machen, indem man Bälle gegen sie wirft. Das passiert aus einer direktionalen Richtung, die immer einer Seite des Blocks zugewandt ist. Es gibt dabei verschiedene Arten von Bällen und sozusagen Power-Ups, die direkt in das Spielgeschehen eingreifen.

Grafisch ist das Spiel dabei sehr minimalistisch gehalten, sieht aber stimmig und rund aus. Auch der Soundtrack und die Effekte klingen gut und sehen schön aus. Vor allem die Physik hinter dem Spiel hat etwas angenehmes und es ist schon fast beruhigend, den Blöcken beim Fallen zuzuschauen.

Viel mehr ist auch nicht zu sagen. Wer ungern Dinge kaputt macht und nicht so gern überlegt, der sollte nach einem anderen Spiel Ausschau halten. Wer kein Gewissen hat und einfach kleine Blöcke vernichten kann und zudem noch seinen Kopf ein bisschen (nicht zu sehr) anstrengen mag, der kann einen Blick auf das Spiel riskieren. Eine klare Empfehlung von mir.
